intro: Elatostema velutinicaule, commonly known as the velvet-stemmed elatostema, is a small herbaceous plant belonging to the family Urticaceae. It is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. The plant produces tiny greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Elatostema velutinicaule is noted for its ability to thrive in low-light conditions and its preference for well-drained, nutrient-rich soils.
